newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends mixed in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends mixed in quiet market.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were quoted mixed at the close, in a holiday-influenced market devoid of any buying interest, traders said.

"There's been no change in sentiment," said a trader, referring to the extension of the Chinese Lunar New Year and Moslem Eid al-Fitr festive holidays from last week, which have left the market in a lull.

At the close, March RSS1 buyer was quoted at 305.50 cents ($1.23) a kg by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board (MRELB), unchanged from Wednesday. February SMR20 ended half cent higher at 300 cents.
The INRO five-day average was 233.26 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Feb 12 from 232.43 on Feb 11. The daily indicator was at 235.61 against 233.43.
